title: Trina and Nicki Minaj drop 'BAPS' and flip a 2000 classic
paragraphs: Trina and Nicki Minaj are ready for some new music.
The two rappers have collaborated on a song that dropped Wednesday called “BAPS.” The four-minute New Orleans-styled beat is from Trina’s upcoming album “The One,” which is available this Friday.

The song samples from the 2000 song “Project B***,” from the supergroup Cash Money Millionaires, which included the Big Tymer$ – Birdman and Mannie Fresh – and B.G., Juvenile, Lil Wayne and Turk from the Hot Boy$.
This isn’t the first collaboration for the duo. Trina and Minaj have worked together before on hits, such as “5 Star (Remix)” and “Dang A Lang.”
And Minaj is just one guest artist featured on Trina’s 15-track album. Others include 2 Chainz, DJ Khaled, K. Michelle, Kelly Price and Lil Wayne.
Minaj released her album “Queen” last year and has teased her upcoming single “Megatron,” which is set to drop on Friday.
